description: Big Foamy Head is all about Beer, Blues and Barbecue
title: Beer Podcast Show – Beer Blues and Barbecue Show Podcast – Big Foamy Head

episodes.title: Show 160 - Beer Death March
episodes.description: In which we find our heroes recovering after slaying the mighty GABF. Basically, we're all beat down by the waves of amazing beer we poured down our beerholes over a 5 day period. And it shows in the thumps and bumps and gravelly voices in this podcast. All you cheap bastards can enjoy the sensation […]

episodes.title: Show 159 - Seven Year Itch
episodes.description: We couldn't let a whole year go by without a show. We managed to get everyone together for a round or two of beers in front of recording devices, and this is what you get. We had a wide range of beers on this show - from Belgians to Hop Bombs, and relived some moments […]

episodes.title: Show 158 - IPAs for Retards
episodes.description: In celebration of National IPA Day, we present a tutorial on the nuances of hops and IPAs for our hop-challenged friends. Actually, we just drink some great beers and babble on endlessly about Vince Gill, beer festivals, hot chicken, t-shirts, and beertards. We kick it off with a Great Divide 18th Anniversary Wood Aged Double […]

episodes.title: Show 157 - Lips of Brett
episodes.description: We drink a brett beer that may or may not be half assed. Depends on what you are looking for and whether you are all about the Styles. We're talking about the collaboration between New Belgium and Lost Abbey called Brett Beer that takes a beating on the beer boards. We give you the straight […]

episodes.title: Show 156 - Palate Wrecker
episodes.description: Why on earth, you might ask, would you want to wreck your palate. Much like climbing Mt Everest, in the immortal words of George Mallory - «Because it was there!» Actually we had a much better and more hedonistic reason - because it was darned tasty!! We are of course talking about Green Flashes «Palate […]

episodes.title: Show 155 - Rise of the Big Beers
episodes.description: There has always been a special place in our hearts for the big beer, and the barleywine of course. Join us for some big fine beers from Sam Adams (yes, those guys) Imperial Series. One is a homerun, the other a swing and a miss. We also indulge in a little Hebrew number from Schmaltz, […]

episodes.title: Show 154 - The Deviant Show
episodes.description: It took a beer this good to drag our asses out of retirement and produce a NSFW show. Join us as we sample Deviant Dale, an imperial version of Dale's Pale Ale. Oskar Blues hit a home run with this one. It's an 8% tallboy can that will leave you smiling. Great nose, great taste, […]

episodes.title: Weyerbacher Beer Show - Show 153
episodes.description: Weyerbacher makes some exceptional beer and we try out three of their best. Interviews with Chris Wilson of Weyerbacher and some Mississippi Beer Activists bring you up to date on some hop and barley goodness. In Memoriam: Weyerbacher - Imperial Pumpkin Ale Weyerbacher - QUAD Weyerbacher - Blithering Idiot

episodes.title: Big Beers, Belgians and Barleywines - Laura Lodge
episodes.description: The last and final interview from the Big Beers, Belgians and Barleywine festival. This is another interview that is long overdue. Laura and her brother Bill do a remarkable job organizing this event. Simply remarkable. Mike Paige from the Hop Barley and the Alers continues with the interview duties. Big Beers, Belgians and Barleywines 2011 […]

episodes.title: Big Beers 2011 - Grimm Brothers Brewhouse
episodes.description: BigFoamyHead continues to focus on startup breweries - our fourth interview from the Big Beers, Belgians and Barleywine festival is with Grimm Brothers Brewhouse - established in 2010 in Loveland. I've been wanting to interview these guys for a long time. I have been following Aaron's progress setting up this business with quite a bit […]

episodes.title: Big Beers 2011 - Crazy Mountain
episodes.description: BigFoamyHead continues to focus on startup breweries - our third interview from the Big Beers, Belgians and Barleywine festival is with Crazy Mountain - established in 2010 in Eagle County. Kevin gives a great (and honest) insight on the battle for tap handles and breaking into the market. Mike Paige from the Hop Barley and […]

episodes.title: Big Beers, Belgians and Barleywines - Funkwerks
episodes.description: The Big Beers, Belgians and Barleywines festival in Vail, CO is a brewers favorite. Location and time have helped build this to a world class event. Greg Koch, Adam Avery, Sam Calagione, Peter Bouckaert, Tomme Arthur and others help make this an industry top notch event. They bring their biggest and best offerings. This year, […]

episodes.title: Big Beers, Belgians and Barleywines - Upslope Brewing Company
episodes.description: The Big Beers, Belgians and Barleywines festival in Vail, CO is a brewers favorite. Location and time have helped build this to a world class event. Greg Koch, Adam Avery, Sam Calagione, Peter Bouckaert, Tomme Arthur and others help make this an industry top notch event. They bring their biggest and best offerings. This year, […]

episodes.title: The Lost Interviews - World Brewers Forum - Dana and Jimmy
episodes.description: The fifth and final of the lost interviews series. In what has become a tradition, BigFoamyHead interviews the coordinators of the World Brewers Forum - Dana Johnson and Jim Fixari. It's a nice recap for the event. GABF WBF 2010 Interview 5!!

episodes.title: The Lost Interviews - Mick interviews Rick
episodes.description: The third of the lost interviews series. Mick interviews Rick. Simply put, Mick is brilliant. He has one of the most sophisticated homebrew systems I've ever seen. It's computer controlled, SRC relayed, PID controlled, yada-yada. The guy can control his brew day while watching a football game upstairs. When Mick was bored being a EE […]

episodes.title: The Lost Interviews - Diamond Bear
episodes.description: The fourth of our "Lost Interview" series. We have been wanting to help promote Diamond Bear Arkansas for a number of years. This is a repeat of an interview from many years ago with John, one of the 10 co-owners. Diamond Bear is the «only production» brewery in Arkansas and they also make a mean […]

episodes.title: The Lost Interviews - Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.description: The second of our "Lost Interview" series. If you've been living under a rock, you may not know who Jamil is. He's a fixture on the Brewing Network and most homebrewers aspire to get to his level of brewing to style - he's won 2 Ninkasi awards (2004 and 2007)! Coauthor of "Brewing Classic Styles" […]

episodes.title: The Lost Interviews - Chuck Skypeck
episodes.description: What happened? One day it's September, then you turn around and it's a new year. No excuses - just simple humble apologies! I'm going to fire these out in pretty quick order - there are 5 total interviews from the 2010 Great American Beer Festival and the World Brewers Forum. Our first features brother Mike […]

episodes.title: Short Ones - Show 2
episodes.description: This week we continue our exploration into beer with «stuff», including cheese. Gah. Also check out our holiday guide with reports from Phil of My Life as a Foodie and Groucho from The Beer Report. New beers and new blogs round this quality 9 minutes out. Listen up!

episodes.title: Short Ones - Show 1
episodes.description: The debut of the BigFoamyHead.com show spin-off. Short Ones is a quick show that focuses on craft beer happenings on the web - who's talking about what beer and where, trends and events, and blogs and podcasts you need to know about, and its ONLY on Facebook and BigFoamyHead.com. Take 9 and 1/2 minutes of […]
